title.description: A human-readable title for the graph

version.description:
Semantic version of the graph
See https://semver.org/

nodes.description: All of the nodes in the graph

items.description: A "step" or "function" in the program which performs computation

id.description: Identifier for this node that is unique to this graph

type.description: The type of the node. Must be either a built-in type or a type provided by a kit.

edges.description: All of the edges in the graph

items.description: A connection between two nodes through which data flows

from.description: The ID of the source node

to.description: The ID of the destination node

out.description:
The output port of the `from` node.
If "*", then all outputs of the `from` node are passed to the `to` node. In this case `in` must be empty string or undefined.
If undefined or empty string, then no data is passed, and the nodes are instead connected purely for yielding control flow. In this case `in` must be empty string or undefined.

in.description:
The input port of the `to` node.
Must be empty string or undefined if and only if `out` is either "*" or itself empty string or undefined.

optional.description: If true, nodes connected to this edge won't wait for data to appear before proceding with execution.

constant.description: If true, the most recent data that passed through this edge will remain available indefinitely, instead of being destructively consumed.

kits.description: All of the kits this graph depends on

items.description: A library that will be imported prior to execution for providing handlers for non built-in node types.

graphs.description: Sub-graphs that can be referred to by nodes in the parent graph.

args.description: Arguments that are passed to the graph, useful to bind values to lambdas.
